programme.title: PALM TREES DOWN 3RD ST.
programme.desc: While searching for her father, Nikki meets her half-sister Winter for the first time on the streets of San Francisco.

programme.title: The Unseen
programme.desc: The Unseen is about art, identity and solitude. It presents three interconnected vignettes that follow three different characters as they slip into spaces in Namibian society mostly unseen.

programme.title: LA SOLEDAD
programme.desc: Capturing the life of real people amidst the Venezuelan crisis, La Soledad is the story of JosĂ©, a young father who discovers that the dilapidated mansion he occupies will soon be demolished. programme.title: THE BLACK MOZART IN CUBA
programme.desc: The Black Mozart in Cuba is the latest act in the rehabilitation of the memory of this extraordinary human being.

programme.title: Inns of Color
programme.desc: Inns of Color showcases a collective of five uniquely-themed African American owned bed and breakfasts."

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 1
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: FOUR POINTS
programme.desc: Four average citizens have been selected by the newly elected tech-genius President of the United States to participate in a game.

programme.title: ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: The Third Space EP1
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: BECOMING FREE
programme.desc: Becoming Free follows three young people who are returning home to Washington, DC, after spending years or decades behind bars.

programme.title: WOLF
programme.desc: A family is shaken to the core when they discover their son has been molested. As they struggle to deal with the betrayal, their son heads towards a total mental collapse because of his love for his abuser, while his abuser attempts to exorcise his own past demons.

programme.desc: This series highlights young black entrepreneurs on their endeavors and how they became successful in their respective fields.

programme.title: MONA
programme.desc: In June 1973, a week before the Portuguese Prime Minister, Dr Ribeiro, is due to arrive in London for a state visit, protests all over the city are growing due to Portugal's harsh foreign policy in its colony of Mozambique.

programme.title: FOUR POINTS

programme.title: DISTRICT GREENWOOD
programme.desc: District Greenwood: the Amalgamated People features some of today's African American entrepreneurs, using their testimonials as proven examples of how to build a successful business

programme.title: BLACK ABROAD
programme.desc: Two friends document their experiences traveling while meeting with local transplants to explore the modern African Diaspora.

programme.title: WE ARE THANKFUL
programme.desc: A young man from a South African township dreams of being an actor and does all he can to make his dreams a reality when a film production comes to a nearby town.

programme.title: EMERGER
programme.desc: As the first woman to surf in her hometown of Dakar, Senegal, Khadjou Sambe emerged from a patriarchal system to become an icon for black women surfers all over the globe and pave the way for the next generation.

programme.title: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump At The Sun
programme.desc: Zora Neale Hurston: Jump at the Sun is a moving interpretation of Zora Neale Hurston's life and career.
